issue.title: [Wiki] Release management guide does not explain how to set up Crossbow or where to find instructions
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-3571](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3571). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
If you follow the guide, at one point it says "Launch a Crossbow build" but provides no link to the setup instructions for this

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3571?focusedCommentId=16657508) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Another issue is that Crossbow does not seem to be documented at all on the wiki unless I'm missing something. There's a placeholder for it on the front page, though

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3571?focusedCommentId=16762810) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
`[~kszucs]` what is the state of the documentation here?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3571?focusedCommentId=16917803) by Krisztian Szucs (kszucs):*
It does actually link the README, but will update to the documentation page.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3571?focusedCommentId=16917837) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
It would be great if you can move everything to Sphinx

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3571?focusedCommentId=16919388) by Krisztian Szucs (kszucs):*
Yeah, I've moved the crossbow README to sphinx. Do you mean the whole release management guide?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3571?focusedCommentId=16919756) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I'm looking at the release management guide and it says

"Setup crossbow as described in its README"

So I think we can merge the Sphinx port of the README and then update the wiki page

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3571?focusedCommentId=17287423) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Is this still a problem?
